sen.j: 後亀山天皇（ごかめやまてんのう、正平 (日本)2年/貞和3年（1347年）？ - 応永31年4月12日 (旧暦)（1424年5月10日））は、南北朝時代 (日本)の第99代、南朝最後の第4代天皇（在位：弘和3年/永徳3年（1383年）10月 - 元中9年/明徳3年10月5日 (旧暦)（1392年11月19日））。
sen.e: Emperor Gokameyama (1347? - May 10, 1424) is the 99th Emperor in the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan) and the last and fourth Emperor in the Southern Court (reign: November/December 1383 - November 19, 1392).

sen.e: As the Southern Court (Japan) was decided to be the official court in 1911, Emperor Gokameyama came to be recognized as one of the former emperors.

sen.e: In the end of 1383, Emperor Chokei abdicated and Emperor Gokameyama ascended the throne.

sen.e: Chokei was a hard-liner towards bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun), and it is said that a policy conflict existed inside the Southern Court.

sen.e: In view of the fact that peace negotiations began between the Court and the bakufu after Gokameyama was enthroned, it is assumed that the enthronement of Gokameyama was supported by the peace group.

sen.j: 在位9年、衰微する南朝政権を支えた。

sen.e: In October 1392, Yoshimitsu ASHIKAGA, the third shogun of Muromachi bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun), presented conditions of peace making between the Northern and Southern Courts, and the Emperor agreed to accept the conditions.

sen.j: ここに南北朝時代は終わり、皇統は北朝の一統に帰することとなった。
sen.e: Accordingly, the period of the Northern and Southern Courts came to an end, and the imperial line was integrated into the line of the Northern Court.

sen.j: 後亀山は後年、両朝合一を決断した理由について、永年の争いを止め、民間の憂いを除くためだったと述懐している。
sen.e: Later Gokameyama recalled that he decided to agree to the unification of the Northern and Southern Courts to cease the long-time conflict and remove people's anxiety.

sen.j: この事件について、『看聞日記』には生活上の困窮によるものと見えるが、当時の幕府が講和条件（両統迭立）に反して後小松天皇皇子の躬仁親王（後の称光天皇）の即位を目論んでいることから、そのような動きに不満を抱く後亀山法皇の抗議行動であったとも考えられる。
sen.e: "Kanmon Nikki" (Diary of Imperial Prince Fushimi no miya Sadafusa) suggests that this event was caused by dire poverty; however, it is also assumed that the bakufu at that time attempted to have Imperial Prince Mihito (later Emperor Shoko), the prince of Emperor Gokomatsu, take over the throne against the conditions of peace (ryoto tetsuritsu (alternate accedence from two ancestries of imperial families)), of which Cloistered Emperor Gokameyama complained and took action against.
